channel.title: Achievement Icons?
channel.description:
[img]https://www.wiki.blackmesasource.com/images/d/df/Icon_preview.jpg[/img]
Some are really bizzare while a few seem understandable. To make it easy we could address them as if they are in a grid, A1, D3, B4 etc.
Some obvious ones are (A3=Drinking a soda from a vending machine), (B3=Disturbing the guy in the bathroom) and (C2=Perhaps killing five enemies with one grenade?). D3 probably has to do with the Tau Cannon or Gluon Gun.

item.title: Achievement Icons?
item.dc:creator: Kaweebo
item.description:
I wouldn’t mind getting an achievement from annoying the scientists by refusing to do the experiment, though. XD

item.title: Achievement Icons?
item.dc:creator: Kazioo
item.description:
I’ve found this on Google. I’m not sure if it is real or fake:

Story: “Flavor Transormation” - Ruin the microwave casserole.
Story: “Press their Buttons” - Tamper with the alarm and laptop in Anomalous Materials
Story: “Charging my Laser” - Switch on all four laser beams in Questionable Ethics
Story: “Brownian Motion” - Pass the toilet paper to the Scientist in need (devnote: Changing room)
Combat: “Mega Hertz” - Kill five enemies with one Grenade.
Combat: “Indigestion” - Kill a Barnacle with a Satchel.
Stupid: “With friends like these” - Get killed by your own Snarks.
Stupid: “Nuclear Fishin’” - Kill an Ichtyosaur with Uranium. (devnote:Tau or Gluon)
Story: “Resonance Procrastinator” - Refuse to insert the specimen into the Anti-Mass Spectrometer.
Story: “Ethically Questionable” - Conduct research in all unethical experiments in Questionable Ethics.
Combat: “Kill it with FIRE” - Kill a headcrab using FIRE!
Combat: “My little friend” - Kill 10 enemies with snarks
Grinding: “Caffeine Freak” - extract soda from 20 soda machines
Grinding: “Quaff To Maek Pingun” - Find the hidden purple hats in every map

Read full topic

item.title: Achievement Icons?
item.dc:creator: Disturbulator
item.description:
Actually… It looks like a crude representation of the uncertainty principle, with the dotted lines representing all the ‘possible’ ways a subatomic particles can travel between points A and B.

As for what signifigence in the GAME it has… egh, too lazy to put the think cap on.

Read full topic

item.title: Achievement Icons?
item.dc:creator: TheDragonMask
item.description:
I think he’s saying that D5 is probably an achievement for getting lost in On A Rail. Possibly if you take much longer than it should take given the chapter has been shortened, or maybe if you revisit too many areas too many times.

item.description:

It looks more related to using the Air Strikes during the latter half of ‘Forget About Freeman’. Perhaps nailing and destroying the barriers with only (the first?) Three tries.
